ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student, as it really helps to refine the essential analytical skills of our discipline.

I would recommend this course to students outside of the department given that this course allows students to appreciate various research approaches and gain better insight that will better prepare them for their own research agenda.Most of the reading material is good and relevant.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: very helpful for building my own research project
This course was helpful as a general basis for generating a method for building sociological arguments. As such, it was essential for formulating my dissertation/research.

The course absolutely helped with familiarizing myself with research agendas although I wish there was more on ethnographic methods. It also helped with analyses of journal articles in the field of sociology. However, I do feel that it leaned too heavily on a positivist approach and didnt offer equal attention to other approaches in the field.

I got a much better sense of mainstream qualitative research in sociology, and in particular the research expectations of ASR and ASJ. This is helpful to me as I start working on my second year paper.
